channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024051286
item.description:
Report X-2024051286

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT PACKAGE LEFT NEAR DMP AREA TO BE PROCESSED, RESPONDER NOTICED WET SPOT ON CORNER OF PACKAGE, NO OTHER DAMAGE SEEN ON OUTSIDE PACKAGING. RESPONDER OPENED AND SAW ONE CONTAINER HAD LEAK AND RESIDUE AND ALSO LOOSE CAP WITH BROKEN SEAL. OTHER 3 CONTAINERS HAD NO RESIDUE OR LEAKAGE, BUT CAPS WERE LOOSE. RESPONDER REMOVED LEAKING CONTAINER TO PROCESS THROUGH DMP. OTHER 3 CONTAINERS TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER WITH SALVAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2024050686
item.description:
Report E-2024050686

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: TROY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 23, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was crushed in transit and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. Crews placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum, deployed absorbents to the impacted area, and recovered them with hand tools. All spent absorbents and impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050627
item.description:
Report E-2024050627

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-cups of Muscle Magic J73 Super D Degreaser was released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to improper loading by terminal XSL. A nail in the pallet punctured the pail. The release impacted trailer #3153478. The caller stated that the release had already been cleaned up. ERTS reviewed with the caller that they need to call ERTS before they clean any release. The impacted pail and spent Oil Dri were containerized into one 30-gallon poly drum.
